name: ListFindings
description:
Retrieve a list of security findings from Datadog.

Use this tool to obtain a list of security findings, including misconfigurations and identity risks from Datadog. You can apply filters to customize the search results and include additional details by specifying parameters. The response includes summary details of each finding along with pagination metadata.

parameters.name: max_findings_limit
parameters.description: Set the maximum number of findings to return, up to a limit of 1000.

value_schema.description: Limit the number of findings returned. Must be <= 1000.

parameters.name: snapshot_timestamp
parameters.description: Specify the Unix timestamp (in milliseconds) to get findings for a specific snapshot of time.

value_schema.description: Return findings for a given snapshot of time (Unix ms).

parameters.name: next_page_cursor
parameters.description: Use this to return the next page of findings starting from this cursor's position.

value_schema.description: Return the next page of findings pointed to by the cursor.

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Specify tags to filter findings. Use the format `tag_key:tag_value`. Supports multiple tags separated by commas.

value_schema.description: Return findings that have these associated tags (repeatable).

parameters.name: filter_by_evaluation_change_date
parameters.description: Specify a date (Unix ms) or date range (using comparison operators) to find results altered from pass to fail or vice versa.

value_schema.description: Return findings that have changed from pass to fail or vice versa on a specified date (Unix ms) or date range (using comparison operators).

parameters.name: filter_by_rule_id
parameters.description: Provide a specific rule ID to filter findings related to that rule.

value_schema.description: Return findings for the specified rule ID.

parameters.name: filter_by_rule_name
parameters.description: Specify the rule name to return findings associated with it. This filters findings based on the provided rule name.

value_schema.description: Return findings for the specified rule.

parameters.name: filter_by_resource_type
parameters.description: Return findings only for the specified resource type. Use to narrow down results to specific resource types, such as 'aws', 'gcp', etc.

value_schema.description: Return only findings for the specified resource type.

parameters.name: filter_by_resource_id
parameters.description: Return only findings for the specified resource ID.

value_schema.description: Return only findings for the specified resource id.

parameters.name: filter_discovery_timestamp
parameters.description: Return findings discovered at a specific time (Unix ms) or within a date range using comparison operators (e.g., `>`, `<=`).

value_schema.description: Return findings that were found on a specified date (Unix ms) or date range (using comparison operators).

parameters.name: filter_evaluation_status
parameters.description: Specify to return only findings that are either 'pass' or 'fail'.

value_schema.description: Return only `pass` or `fail` findings.

parameters.name: status_filter
parameters.description: Specify the status of findings to return: critical, high, medium, low, or info.

value_schema.description: Return only findings with the specified status.

parameters.name: vulnerability_type_filters
parameters.description: A list of strings to filter findings by matching vulnerability types. Repeatable for multiple types.

value_schema.description: Return findings that match the selected vulnerability types (repeatable).

parameters.name: return_muted_findings
parameters.description: Set to `true` to return muted findings. Set to `false` to exclude them.

value_schema.description: Set to `true` to return findings that are muted. Set to `false` to return unmuted findings.

parameters.name: include_detailed_findings
parameters.description: Set to true to retrieve additional fields like external ID, description, and IP addresses for some findings.

value_schema.description: Return additional fields for some findings.
